channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8774] Add BatchSize and Filter to Thrift2
item.description: Attached Patch will add BatchSize and Filter support to Thrift2
item.summary: Add BatchSize and Filter to Thrift2

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
See HBASE-6073. It's also regarding on adding filter to Thrift2.

1 minor problem in the patch:


+    boolean this_present_filterString = true && this.isSetFilterString();

+    boolean that_present_filterString = true && that.isSetFilterString();

"true" is redundant.

In addition, I suggest to add 1 unit test. Anyway, it's a nice patch.

'true' is there because the rest of the thrift and thrift2 had that format. For example 


    boolean this_present_columns = true && this.isSetColumns();

    boolean that_present_columns = true && that.isSetColumns();

HBASE-6073 patch is missing the modification to thrift2.generated.TScan.java and thrift2.generated.TGet.java.
Hamed Madani could you please let me know if your patch is complete, i.e. includes all of the changes in HBASE-6073?

Yes Lars, this patch is complete. It adds filterString to both Scan and Get also adds BatchSize to Scan.
However there is a difference between this patch and HBASE-6073. This patch simply adds filterString to Scan and Get object identical to what already exists in Thrift1. HBASE-6073 create a new schema called TFilterList and TFilter and use that new schema instead.

Hey Hamed Madani, so you followed HBASE-4176 more closely? What do you think, should we merge the two, i.e yours and HBASE-6073? It seems useful while we are at it. I can take a stab if you have no time. Let me know.

Yes Lars. The reason I followed HBASE-4176 was , it made it easier for us to move from thrift1 to thrift2. Also it has been tested before with folks running thrift1. Moreover, from what I understand from HBASE-6073 it seems 


 * Specify boolean operator for TFilterList:

 *  - MUST_PASS_ALL means AND boolean operation

 *  - MUST_PASS_ONE means OR boolean operation

 */

enum TFilterListOperator {

  MUST_PASS_ALL = 0,

  MUST_PASS_ONE = 1

}



/**

* Represents a server side filter list

*

*/

struct TFilterList {

+  1: required TFilterListOperator operator,

  2: required list<TFilter> filters

}

limits you to either AND all filters or OR all of them. Whereas with HBASE-4176 you can have something like “(Filter1 AND Filter2) OR Filter3"
There is also HBASE-6073 close the scanner when the scanner doesn't have any more results to return. I can certainly merge the two to include this feature. Let me know what you think.
If you like me to use HBASE-6073 approach for this patch, I can modify the patch. Please let me know what you think.

Hi Hamed Madani, is HBASE-6073's scanner closing not more related to HBASE-3852? We should handle that separately.

I am going to create an umbrella issue to bring Thrift2 into shape, let's add it there.

I do now understand what you are saying about filter lists and how ParseFilter is already handling vs. HBASE-6073, which is lacking features in comparison. I was also looking at HBASE-5428, which we need to port (among a few others), and it uses ParseFilter too as-is. So I think we should close out HBASE-6073, apply your patch here, and add a new issue for the scanner closing part of HBASE-6073. You want to do that latter part?

Do you want me to create a patch out of HBASE-6073 to close the scanner when there are no result or do you think with HBASE-3852, that's unnecessary ? I added a third parameter to getScannerRows to close the scanner as soon as it gets the result. I understand that introducing a third parameter might be very specific to our use case, that's why I did not create a patch for it. What do you think about it? 


  public List<TResult> getScannerRows(int scannerId, int numRows, boolean once) throws TIOError,

      TIllegalArgument, TException {

    ResultScanner scanner = getScanner(scannerId);

    if (scanner == null) {

      TIllegalArgument ex = new TIllegalArgument();

      ex.setMessage("Invalid scanner Id");

      throw ex;

    }



    try {

      List<TResult> result = resultsFromHBase(scanner.next(numRows));

      if (once) {

        removeScanner(scannerId);

      }

      return result;

    } catch (IOException e) {

      throw getTIOError(e);

    }

  }
Re-generate TScan and TGet files with Thrift 0.9. Updated formatting as well.
Hi Lars George, I have added attribute to scan , get , delete , increment and put. do you want me to update this patch or make a new one base on current trunk ?

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12590128/HBASE_8774_v2.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6167//testReport/

This message is automatically generated.

Hi Hamed Madani, thanks for your continued help with this.

Do you want me to create a patch out of HBASE-6073 to close the scanner when there are no result or do you think with HBASE-3852, that's unnecessary ?

That is something we need to figure out. How about we document the partial patch of HBASE-6073 in HBASE-3852 and then close the former as superseded by HBASE-3852 and HBASE-8774?

I added a third parameter to getScannerRows to close the scanner as soon as it gets the result.

I think that is a interesting option to offer to clients. But I also think this might warrant a separate call to show the distinction. Although we can make that optional and therefore keep one call. I actually tend to the latter having just iterated over both solutions.

Re-generate TScan and TGet files with Thrift 0.9. Updated formatting as well.

Oh good idea What formatting did you update BTW?

I have added attribute to scan , get , delete , increment and put. do you want me to update this patch or make a new one base on current trunk ?

Please see HBASE-8832, I think that is what you are referring to? Please add a patch of off trunk, we can merge the changes one after the other. And attach the patch over there please. Good on you Hamed!

As for the patch


+typedef binary Text

We dropped Text from the definition file in Thrift 2 (T1 had it). We now use:


exception TIOError {

  1: optional string message

}

In other words "string" (see http://thrift.apache.org/docs/types/). Is there a reason why you need to use Text? The same page states that "binary" is specific for Java?

Special Types
binary: a sequence of unencoded bytes

N.B.: This is currently a specialized form of the string type above, added to provide better interoperability with Java. The current plan-of-record is to elevate this to a base type at some point.

Should we simply drop the definition of Text and use binary or string inline instead?

Thank you Lars George, you are right about the Text type. I doubled check and as you suggested, changed filterString type to binary. updated the patch

As for HBASE-8832 , I have to wait for this patch to get applied to trunk because, I have added "attribute" to struct definitions in hbase.thrift file and if we apply this patch, we have to create a new patch for HBASE-8832 with new numbering in hbase.thrift file. To clarify, if I create a patch for "attribute" right now the TScan struct's number for "attribute" will be 7, but if I create the HBASE-8832 patch after applying HBASE-8774 patch , the "attribute" number will be "9: optional map<binary, binary> attributes"


struct TScan {

  1: optional binary startRow,

  2: optional binary stopRow,

  3: optional list<TColumn> columns

  4: optional i32 caching,

  5: optional i32 maxVersions=1,

  6: optional TTimeRange timeRange,

 *7:* optional binary filterString,

 *8:* optional i32 batchSize

}

I did not apply formatting to generated files (hence lines longer than 100 characters) because if I apply formatting to these files , it will make applying the future patches to these auto-generated files non-trivial. If you like me to apply formatting to generated files , please let me know. ( formatting I mentioned for patch_v2 was for ThriftUtilities.java)

Makes sense Hamed Madani, I'll apply to 0.94, 0.95 and trunk soon (testing patch now). Then we can do HBASE-8832 next. Thanks!

We should add a unit test for this, see HBASE-8840. We could do both in one go, i.e. add a unit test that spins up a cluster and for this issue is running a scan with and without a filter, checking the results. That could then be extended in HBASE-8840. You up for adding this test here? If not, I can give it a shot.
well I don't feel confident enough to take on HBASE-8840 yet. but I can certainly try to add to TestThriftHBaseServiceHandler.testScan() or create a new test for testing batchSize and filterString.
I was not sure how to test scan batchSize. The updated patch test filterString.

 * TODO: Filter, Locks

I thought one of your earlier patches did that, but the last does not?
Thank you Lars George for reviewing this patch. Updated the patch and removed the line you mentioned.
Same as v4 from Hamed Madani but removing extra comment line which is now obsolete.
